ovdesc.p: This application is used to print the balance details of the base deals for specified report lines.
The functions (I)nput and (C)opy are used to load the records into the file.
The (V)erify function is used to print the report lines.

desc.p: Identifies the report for which the lines are to be printed.
3 - 21 SWIFT characters. Multivalue field associated with fields 3.1 and 4.1. Mandatory input.
Must be an ID of a header record in RE.STAT.REPORT.HEAD.
This field is used for entering notes and is not used anywhere else.
Up to 35 alphanumeric characters. Multivalue field. Optional input.
Identifies the different records in this file.
Identifies the last line number to be printed.
Line number 9999 represents the last available line for the report.
If specific line numbers required then this field should be left blank.
1 - 4 numeric characters. Sub valued field associated with field 3.1.1 and multivalue field associated with field 2.1.
If not specified as 9999 then must be present in RE.STAT.REP.LINE as part of the report specified in REPORT NAME (Field 2.1).
Identifies the first line number to be printed.
Line number 0001 represents first available line for the report.
If specific line numbers required then this field should have the line numbers required while LINE NO END (Field 4.1.1) is left null.
1 - 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input. Sub valued field associated with field 4.1.1 and multivalue field associated with field 2.1
If not specified as 0001 then must be present in RE.STAT.REP.LINE as part of the report specified in REPORT NAME (Field 2.1).
